Package jester

Class JesterTransform

java.lang.Object
jester.JesterTransform
public class JesterTransform extends Object
Represents a 2D transformation using a 3x3 matrix. This class provides methods for translation, rotation, scaling, and other transformations.

    • identity

      public void identity()
      Resets the transformation to the identity matrix.

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets the transformation to the identity matrix.

    • translate

      public void translate(float x, float y)
      Translates the transformation by the specified x and y values.
      Parameters:
      x - The amount to translate in the x direction.
      y - The amount to translate in the y direction.

    • rotate

      public void rotate(float radians)
      Rotates the transformation by the specified angle in radians.
      Parameters:
      radians - The angle to rotate in radians.

    • scale

      public void scale(float sx, float sy)
      Scales the transformation by the specified x and y factors.
      Parameters:
      sx - The scaling factor in the x direction.
      sy - The scaling factor in the y direction.

    • shear

      public void shear(float sx, float sy)
      Applies shearing to the transformation by the specified x and y factors.
      Parameters:
      sx - The shear factor in the x direction.
      sy - The shear factor in the y direction.

    • apply

      public JesterVector2 apply(JesterVector2 point)
      Applies the transformation to a given point.
      Parameters:
      point - The point to transform.
      Returns:
      A new JesterVector2 representing the transformed point.

    • inverse

      public JesterTransform inverse()
      Computes the inverse of the transformation.
      Returns:
      A new JesterTransform representing the inverse transformation.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the determinant is too close to 0.

    • inverseTransformPoint

      public JesterVector2 inverseTransformPoint(JesterVector2 point)
      Applies the inverse transformation to a given point.
      Parameters:
      point - The point to transform.
      Returns:
      A new JesterVector2 representing the transformed point.

    • getMatrix

      public float[] getMatrix()
      Gets the current transformation matrix.
      Returns:
      A clone of the current transformation matrix.

    • setMatrix

      public void setMatrix(float[] newMatrix)
      Sets the transformation matrix to a new matrix.
      Parameters:
      newMatrix - The new matrix to set.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the new matrix does not have 9 elements.

    • isAffine2DTransform

      public boolean isAffine2DTransform()
      Checks if the transformation is an affine 2D transformation.
      Returns:
      true if the transformation is affine, false otherwise.

    • setTransformation

      public void setTransformation(float posX, float posY, float rotationRadians, float scaleX, float scaleY)
      Sets the transformation using position, rotation, and scale.
      Parameters:
      posX - The x position.
      posY - The y position.
      rotationRadians - The rotation in radians.
      scaleX - The scaling factor in the x direction.
      scaleY - The scaling factor in the y direction.

    • transformPoint

      public JesterVector2 transformPoint(JesterVector2 point)
      Transforms a point using the current transformation matrix.
      Parameters:
      point - The point to transform.
      Returns:
      A new JesterVector2 representing the transformed point.
